channel.title: -- Help getting server online -- Thank you
channel.description:
[center] First off, I'm using this source: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,514319.0.html
Alright, so here are the steps I did in order:
1. Registered a no-ip address, and dl'ed the DUC to get it working. 2. Used uTorrent to forward my port and ran a test (results below)
[URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/194/forwardport.jpg/][IMG]http://img194.imageshack.us/img194/9928/forwardport.jpg[/img][/URL]
3. Turned Firewall off 4. Changed IP in launch.java of Rune MTP source (as listed by owner) from "0.0.0.0" to my no-ip address.
I compile and run the source. Then, when I compile the client, I make sure the check is on my no-ip address and is running in the DUC. When the client loads, I try to login and it says "Error connecting to server." When I run my source, in the cmd prompt is this:
[URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/854/severbound.jpg/][IMG]http://img854.imageshack.us/img854/4008/severbound.jpg[/img][/URL]
It says something about connecting to the port, so I think it should be forwarded correctly? Do I need to edit something related to ports in the client? If you can help me get it working and get it online, I'd appreciate it. :)[/center]

item.title: -- Help getting server online -- Thank you
item.dc:creator: @Viva_La_Vida Viva La Vida
item.description:
@Viva_La_Vida wrote:

[quote=“RiiPiiNFtW, post:28, topic:414010”][quote author=Christian S. link=topic=515972.msg3743438#msg3743438 date=1315547462]

No problem, if you need any help, message me. I’m working with the same source right now actually.

Just wondering, did you get yours online for other players to access?

Not yet, I’m just editting it. Plus I might go to the 317 version, due to my lack of knowledge on 500+'s.
[/quote]If so, I highly suggest RUNE- MTP 317 revision.[/quote]Does it have the same features as the 500+?

Read full topic

item.title: -- Help getting server online -- Thank you
item.dc:creator: @Viva_La_Vida Viva La Vida
item.description:
@Viva_La_Vida wrote:

Christian S.:

I’ve only ran 317/474’s but it should be the same in this way. If you’re trying to get other people to connect, edit the ip to the IP then need to connect. Upload, and give them the link. Afterwards, change it back to 0.0.0.0 and you connect that way.

Thanks Christian, and RiiPiinFtW, I appreciate all the help.

Read full topic

item.title: -- Help getting server online -- Thank you
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

[quote=“Viva La Vida, post:21, topic:414010”][quote author=RiiPiiNFtW link=topic=515972.msg3743412#msg3743412 date=1315543377]

[quote author=Viva La Vida link=topic=515972.msg3743409#msg3743409 date=1315543282]

Yes. You are hosting locally which means you login using 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0. If you want other people to login set it to your noip.
[/quote]Ok, so I use the localhost to login since I’m hosting. Then, I change the IP in the client from localhost to my no-ip and send it to my friends? Or am I not understanding this properly? Sorry
[/quote]As far as I am concerned, thats the case.

Ha, I wish someone could confirm it, but oh well. I’ll try it, and if it doesn’t seem to work, I’ll ask a member here I guess.[/quote]Hope I helped!

Read full topic

item.title: -- Help getting server online -- Thank you
item.dc:creator: @Viva_La_Vida Viva La Vida
item.description:
@Viva_La_Vida wrote:

[quote=“RiiPiiNFtW, post:16, topic:414010”][quote author=Viva La Vida link=topic=515972.msg3743392#msg3743392 date=1315542564]

[quote author=RiiPiiNFtW link=topic=515972.msg3743386#msg3743386 date=1315542265]

Oh, if its the 614 then I can’t help. I am currently working with the 317 one and i get that but im not all that great with 508+. I guess all I can say is to keep fumbling around with it.

Right, I just don’t know exactly what I’m supposed to change. Idk if the IP should be changed to the no-ip address or if it’s supposed to be changed to the localhost. I just want it to be online, and for other people to connect to it. Not trying to make it huge, but I just want a couple friends to be able to log in, too.
[/quote]Server sided, i believe you need to leave it at local. No-IP uses a DNS that directs through certain ports that it scans for. The port 43594 using UDP and TCP are for sending and recieving packets. So rely on NO-IP to do the work for you while you chill out.

So, all I have to do is send out the client, and my friends can just log in with ease? If I make it a webclient in the future, will I need to change anything? Thanks a lot for all the time/help.
[/quote]Basically. If you set the client to connect to your NO-IP for your friends and players then it should work. Just make sure your server runs on 0.0.0.0:43594[/quote]
Yep, it runs on 0.0.0.0:43594 (in the pic on OP)
But, I’m not sure how I set the client to connect to my no-ip address for players to connect, too. I think that’s my problem. I change the IP to 127.0.0.1 in the launch file, and it lets me log in just fine. But when I change it to my no-ip, that’s when I get the “Error connecting to server” message in the client. When I fix this, I’ll be good to go.

Read full topic

So, all I have to do is send out the client, and my friends can just log in with ease? If I make it a webclient in the future, will I need to change anything? Thanks a lot for all the time/help. :)[/quote]Basically. If you set the client to connect to your NO-IP for your friends and players then it should work. Just make sure your server runs on 0.0.0.0:43594

item.description:
@Viva_La_Vida wrote:

[quote=“RiiPiiNFtW, post:14, topic:414010”][quote author=Viva La Vida link=topic=515972.msg3743382#msg3743382 date=1315542134]

Oh, if its the 614 then I can’t help. I am currently working with the 317 one and i get that but im not all that great with 508+. I guess all I can say is to keep fumbling around with it.

Right, I just don’t know exactly what I’m supposed to change. Idk if the IP should be changed to the no-ip address or if it’s supposed to be changed to the localhost. I just want it to be online, and for other people to connect to it. Not trying to make it huge, but I just want a couple friends to be able to log in, too.
[/quote]Server sided, i believe you need to leave it at local. No-IP uses a DNS that directs through certain ports that it scans for. The port 43594 using UDP and TCP are for sending and recieving packets. So rely on NO-IP to do the work for you while you chill out. :D[/quote]
So, all I have to do is send out the client, and my friends can just log in with ease? Do I leave the IP at 127.0.0.1 when I send it to them, which they use to log in with? Also, if I make it a webclient in the future, will I need to change anything? Thanks a lot for all the time/help.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @F_A_I_L_S Fails
item.description:
@F_A_I_L_S wrote:

[quote=“Viva La Vida, post:8, topic:414010”][quote author=RiiPiiNFtW link=topic=515972.msg3743369#msg3743369 date=1315541554]
Its simple… just edit the client.java to connect your players to you and then jar it and edit the client back to 0.0.0.0 so you can play.
[/quote]
What exactly do I change in the client.java file? Because on the thread I downloaded the source from, the owner simply states you just need to switch some IPs in the launch.java file.

Well, If i were you i’d take down will pay whatever amount, that’s just me though. It’s pointless to pay someone just to help you with a rsps problem.

Done, sorry about that.[/quote]It’s ok, as danny said, Help is free here.

Read full topic
